name: ibb & obb
description: ibb & obb is a two player cooperative game set in a puzzle filled world where gravity goes both up and down. You can only succeed by working closely together. Find a friend for some true local co-op couch fun or match up online.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP (Service Pack 3) Processor: 2 GHz Intel Dual Core Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 2.0 compatible card Storage: 850 MB available space Sound Card: any

reviews.review_text: Incredible and cute puzzle game! You can play it alone but i'd honestly advise to play with a team mate. The coop is much better and funnier. Some puzzles are a bit tough sometimes, but a good teamwork can solve any of them. It's a typical ps3 indie game, original, fun, cute, relaxing. Just awesome if you want to have a great time! I strongly recommend it :) 10/10.

Ibb and Obb is purely a co-op game that has challenging puzzles and the art style is fantastic. This game is for you and a friend to sit down, relax and try beat the puzzles that the game has in stored for you. This game does have a single player feature which requires you to simutaneously control Ibb and Obb. This is very challenging and it can be frustrating at times.  The soundtrack is enjoyable and relaxing. I think it suits the game well.   I recommend that you buy it and have a go with a friend. Challenge yourselves in this wonderful and beautiful co-op game.
My only regret is I received this for free. From a humble bundle. Who is going to give them money now..

One of the most enjoyable co-op experiences I've had. Great puzzles, beautiful art style, cute characters, good music. Get a whole lot of mileage out of a handful of simple gameplay mechanics. You'll find yourself screaming in frustration, shouting and pumping your fist in triumph, erupting in cathartic laughter as it finally seems you and your friend will accomplish the intricate, difficult procedure you've spent so long figuring out and attempting, only to see your friend make a stupid mistake and ruin everything at the last second.  The game only lets you communicate with your online parter by drawing blobby, imprecise lines onscreen. This could be seen as a drawback, but in fact it becomes its own meta-puzzle: how do I explain this detailed series of actions that will involve precise timing, without using any words? You come to develop a rudimentary syntax; you start saying yes and no by moving back and forth and jumping up and down, respectively, or you draw frantic scribbles on the screen to indicate frustration. It's so much more satisfying to solve puzzles this way; you really feel like you've accomplished something beyond the game itself. Of course there are also those infuriating moments when you give up trying to use the in-game language and resort to Steam chat, or even make a phone call and talk through it in real time. And then there are transcendent moments when you and your partner both know exactly what to do without attempting any communication at all.   It's also great fun to be a jerk and push your partner over cliffs or into enemies.   If I have only one criticism it's that if you're playing with more than one friend (say, one online and one IRL) there's no reliable way to keep track of which levels you've finished with each friend. Like, I beat the game with friend A while I was only a few levels in with friend B, and then I'd start up the game with friend B and some of the puzzles would start to seem mighty familiar, and I couldn't be sure if it was only because I'd already played them with friend A, or because I'd also already played them with friend B. You can reset ALL of your progress, which would have made it easier to kow where I was with friend B if I'd started with them AFTER beating the game with friend A, but I had two games going at the same time so deleting my progress with friend A would have deleted the friend B's progress as well, and it wouldn't have been fair to friend A, either, if we ever decided we wanted to go back and try to get all the crystals on certain levels without replaying all the others. The option for separate play 'sessions' could have solved this (I always thought having three save slots in the Zelda games was overkill, but now I see the reasoning behind it). But, lengthy complaint notwithstanding, this is really a minor problem.  I was lucky enough to get this in a double pack as part of a bundle, but It's definitely worth the full price.

One of the best made coop games I've played. It's made of intelligent level design, beautifully simple aesthetics, amazing music, and they manage to increase the difficulty level smoothly from more puzzly bits to get you used to the physics and concepts of the game, to a more platformy end that you can manage well with experience.  Love it!  Definitely a must-play.

Propably the best co-op puzzle alongside Portal 2. Good amount (8-10 hours) of gameplay.  ...and if you decide you like Ibb & Obb or need similar gameplay but also with singleplayer, you should check out Kalimba.

Starts out very interesting and follows a good principle: simple enough that they players always know that they have all the tools they need to solve a puzzle. They also use very frequent mini check points, so you don't have to start a whole level over. ... But then it digresses into really tricky timing platforming with multiple challenging tasks in timed sequenses and the fun sort of drains off to exaspiration. Put another way, when you know how to solve a puzzle but they needlessly have easy to fail tight timing/positioning things that all have to be done as one continuous chain where either person can fail, and have to do it all over again. I think I'd rather play something else at that point.  If you really really love tricky platforming (both pricision/timing and intelectualy challenging), you may really like this game. I liked if for a short while and then hit a point where it felt like a chore and I didn't want to pick it up again.
I haven't played much, so this'll be very short.      Pros
This is the best game for couples that find themselves in a long distance relationship and needing something to bond over c:
The qutest and most fun coop game i have ever played!

This game is perfect for co-op, especially when you see the price of two games compared to one game.  This game looks cute, and I guarantee you, it is. The world, but also the objects and living animals(?), look really beautiful.  The nice thing about this co-op is, that you really need each other. I'm not sure if it's even possible to play it alone.  Also, the hidden levels bring a really nice touch to the game.  The game is hard to play though, it's not easy, especially when you also want to complete the hidden levels, which are even harder than the normal game.  What I also like about this game, is that it is developped by two Dutch companies, which I like, because I am Dutch. But even without this I would defenitily recommend this game!  i would definitely recommend this game!!  Info about the badge and emoticons of the game (NOTE: this is not in the game itself, it costs extra money): Nice about the game, but not really interesting for most people, I guess, is that the game has really nice badges.. At least the level 5 badge and the foil badge. The level badges below 5 I forgot about, so not talking about those. Also, the game has really nice emoticons, that you could get when crafting the badges. Especially the emoticon: :pinkheart:. I had the heart quite some time, then I found out, it's actually Ibb and Obb combined in a heart. This heart is also the level 5 badge.

Oh man, i love this game, its really soothing to play and the little dancing at the end of a level is great.  the gameplay is challenging but not to difficult. im really having lots of fun with this game and am trying to persuade my friends in buying it!

A wonderfully creative co-op platformer with a great art style and a decent level of challenge. Grab an extra control pad and a good friend and try not to murder each other before you see the credits roll.
This game gave me full mastery of clenching my ♥♥♥♥. 10/10
Ain't no party like an Ibb and Obb party, cuz an Ibb and Obb party don't stop!

This is a great game! It's both relaxing and exciting, at times seriously difficult and just plain hilarious if you finally know how to proceed but mess up in the end. Me and my friend normally play FPS's and this is a welcome variation on my game experience dominated by action and speed. The soundtrack adds alot of atmosphere to make this game well worth the money. But make sure to have a good friend to play this with! That makes all the difference.  Go Indie!  Arch
Greatest game of all time.
Rly fun game, enjoyed it so far.

Great game. It's pretty difficult when you're playing with someone and they aren't the best at listening, but that just makes it more fun. These days, most games are about random teammates, which isn't that fun, as you don't get to have that old school bonding moment while playing. I feel like this game captures that perfectly. I haven't completed the game yet, so I'm worried that the game will be a short one, but I suppose since it's so good, that will make up for it.  Amazing art. Perfect soundtrack. What more could I ask for? A level editor would be like a cherry on a perfect cake ;3  Thinking of getting this game? Don't be an idiot. You should have it by now!  8.5/10

If you love playing co-op games with your homie, this is definitely a game for you! This game has fun puzzles to try to solve cooperatively with your friend (local or online) in order to progress through the levels while trying to collect as many points (little white squares that shoot out of enemies) as possible. Even if puzzle games aren't really your cup of tea, this game is still pretty fun just to screw around in (especially trying to squash the miniature ball-dudes first). I definitely wouldn't recommend picking this game up for full price, but if you can get the two-pack for a pretty good discount during a steam sale, I would highly recommend it.
Fun and strategic game to play with you freind. Expect some challenging levels where teamwork is the key!

This is a very cute and very pretty game that can infuriate the impatient at times. Overall the puzzles are pretty cool and very reasonable, but I got stuck a few times in the endlevels, knowing what to do, but failing for 20 minutes straight.  Lag can destroy a persons timing too. I played with a person on the other side of the world and sometimes we had to try a few times because the lag would get the better of his timing. Other than that the world is beautiful and the mousemovements making lines to show the other person what he needs to do is very simple and works perfectly fine. The characters are cute and the music was quite alright. Even though I seem negative about it, overall I really liked this game! I would certainly recommend it!

Its An Amazing Co-op Platformer. I Dont Play It Much Any More But Greatb If You Got A Friend You Want To Play With. Also I Dont Think Single-Player Is Much Fun Way To Hard To Controle And Its Really Hard. Please Get This If You Want A Co-Op Platformer.
Best co-op game ever.

It can take a moment before you find a friend, but albeit quiet the steam community is very friendly :D We very much enjoy the game here even though this isn't everyone's genre. It's cute, quirky and it's quite a challange haha.  9/10 (I highly reccoment buying a two pack straight away)  (i'm sort of missing a singleplayer practice area to jump around and see some basic objects you will encounter but that's not a neccesity)
THE BEST SOUNDTRACKS YOU COULD EVER HEAR.
I lost my only friend after playing it.  10/10
A adorable little game that makes you and your friend rage. 11/10

Is rly good 10/11

Very fun puzzle dual co-op. 7 hours of game time but rewarding when completed.
If you like platforming games and puzzles - no wait, if you like Portal, you'll like this. I'm just wondering how fast until the cursive 'lol' becomes a thing.

ibb & obb is an incredibly artful, simplistic game. You play as some sort of mushroom-blob, guiding your respective mushroom-blob friend to the exit of the levels. It sounds like a simple puzzle game formula that has been tried before.  However, this puzzle game manages to set itself apart. In the very short time I have played it, I have found the game incredibly fluid and polished, the art and animation smooth and fitting to the core gameplay, and the gameplay itself fantastic. It's the kind of game you can pick up and play with a friend so easily, and then can't put down.  The puzzles start out seemingly easy, but continue to get trickier and trickier. The lack of communication besides what you can waggle out with your mouse only adds to the fun, and you'll probaby find yourself either laughing hysterically or screaming frustratedly as one of you grasps the puzzle while the other does not. I can imagine having an unskilled/trolling teammate would somewhat diminish this experience, but if you're in the right mindset, with the right teammate, you'll have a blast.  TL;DR: 9/10. One of my favorite puzzle games I've ever played. Hope to see more.
It obb'd my ibbs.  I'd give it a pass.
In my opinion it`s just so so.And there`s no surprise,the charecters are not cute enough as well,so I just feel a little bit boring...

You better buy this only if you have a friend to play with because the online part is dead in the water. And playing this entirely by yourself is not recommended.  [Rating: 70/100 (for single-player only)]

This game is up there with Portal 2 in terms of puzzles and fun. The level of cooperation needed for this game actually surpasses the amount needed for in almost any other coop game I have played. Incedibly fun, yet incredibly challenging.
very fun game to play with a friend, but also great in single player

Its a real nice game,with nice music. The best is,if you play it together with a friend so you can communicate  because this Game gets hard ^^ Sometimes its like wth am i stupid xDDD Oh and sometimes you just kill your friend because you can push him and kill him like that ^.^

My brother asked to buy this game as we were looking for a co-op puzzle game and it definitely was worth it. You need a lot of luck and also might have to try the levels a few times. But when you succeed, you are more than happy. And the best thing are ibb & obb dancing at the end of a level!
A superb co-op puzzler to play with your bestest friend in the whole wide world.
You know a game is good when it comes out on your b'day.

Beautiful game, which managed me and my gf to stay at the PC and play it for more than one hour when we had to sleep. Awesome soundtrack, really easy to play, strongly cooperative... I recommend this game! :)
Nobody wants to play this game with me. I'm still loving it :)

This is a fun little co-op game, good for passing some time. With a real emphasis on teamwork, the puzzles can really make you think at times. Unfortunately it does get a bit repetitive after playing through 5 or so levels. I would still recommend picking this up on discount if you have a friend that enjoys puzzle games.
An adorable game. Reminiscent of Portal but a bit more simple. Loved playing through this with my boyfriend. Definitely suggest you pick it up :0
Interesting game mechanics, great music and lots of fun. Grab a friend and enjoy the ride :)
Many ibbs and many obbs. 10/10

This game is fun, and represents an excellent example of two player co-operation.  A seemingly simple puzzle/platform concept, but it still manages to present some exciting thinking challenges.  There is no complicated set up or backstory here, and none is required, just grab a friend, jump in, and start playing.  Highly recommend you buy the 'two game pack' and send one to your bestie!!

So, I forget where I first read about this game. Probably somewhere in the vijagame jouranlisms. I really liked the visual aesthetic and the idea of a puzzle platformer built not just with co-op in mind, but built entirely around co-op as a necessary central mechanic. I ended up playing the first level and a half solo just to get a feel for the game, and came away with the impression that it was going to be a cute, clever, but ultimately soft experience.  That was quite some time ago. Recently got into it seriously with a friend, and damn, my initial impression was proven wrong. This game is certainly cute but it is anything but soft. ibb & obb will challenge your brain meat. The semi-hidden bonus stages especially; they gave us several excellent opporutnities to flex our brain muscle and were always very satisfying to solve. Considering all your character can do is move and jump, it's amazing the depth of puzzles they're able to create with concepts like maintaining or building momentum or manipulating which direction gravity pulls your character.  The only basic mechanic you have other than moving and jumping is a little colorful bubble trail thing you can create with either the mouse or the right stick, if you're using a controller. It's the only communication tool you have in-game, and I was impressed with how much information we were able to convey to each other using this simple, visual medium. Of course sometimes we had to open a chat window to talk deeper strategy, but still it's an elegant solution for the issue of communication between players that fits in with the game's minimalist approach to it's mechanics and aesthetic.  I only have a couple negative points to share. The game starts out slow as you learn the mechanics and builds up the complexity on a pretty satisfying curve, but there are a couple challenges that boil down to basically challenges to your manual dexterity rather than your abilty to problem solve, and those are never as satsifying. Secondly, we played online and towards the end experienced some pretty bad lag, which the game was not always good at mitigating. We ended up with some weird lag artifacts like random enemies spawning in locations they shouldn't that only damaged one of the two players, or multiple copies of either ibb or obb respawning at once, or just really long wait times to respawn after death. Generally play was smooth and honestly you have to expect some problems when you play online over a crappy connection, but when the lag got particularly bad, the game had more trouble with it than I was expecting.  It's a relatively short game but there's so few games out there that are anything like it, and those few hours are densely packed. ibb & obb is pure gameplay; there's no text or any exposition of any kind anywhere in the game. If you dig platformers and puzzlers and various combinations thereof, and you've got a friend with similar interests, there are certainly less engaging ways you could split $14. love that the 'Best Friends Forevr' double-pack only costs two dollars more than one copy on its own. If you buy the two-pack and split the cost with a friend, you're both basically getting the game 40% off. That's how strongly the developer believes in their vision of a 2-player co-op puzzle platformer.

best.game. EVER!!! Why: Ever wished to know how it feels to step into a completely alien dreamworld, where you're just....happy, violentlessly going about your way, playing around, testing your limits. I'm in love.

Casual coop adventure for 2 people.  Players can be both local or online connected (steam friends). This game requires both of players to survive until the end. I can't leave my friend alone when I pass the obstacles or make my friend go first into the danger to die. Most of the gameplay is puzzles, in which I talk with another player about how to deal with tricks. Communication is a large part of what I enjoyed in this game, since some tricks are really difficult and we had to join forces. Nicely made coop gameplay, also it has such neat graphic as screenshots show. And.. if you want, this can be played alone with both hands.
This game is really fun with a friend.

It's a great multiplayer game to play with a friend when you're just looking to sit back and relax. it's entertaining and has just the right level of challenge you want from a layed back co-op puzzle game. a must-buy if you pick it up on a sale.
I really like the game. I liked the way I solve the puzzles with my friends
Great game so far! Super cute and fun! I think achievements are a little broken though...

Making seemingly simple puzzles almost impossible due to overthinking is my new hobby. For added effort, I like to complete all the achievments, as the game can be completed with little effort otherwise. So go ahead and grab your favorite snacks and gaming buddy and head out into the mysterious nature of  ibb & obb .
Please make more games!

10/10, aka ☆☆☆☆☆ (five stars). Whoever made this is evil because this game is so frustrating. Good to play with a friend, or sibling, but I warn you! YOU MUST HAVE THE BRAINS!!!!!! (So totally worth 13.99 if you don't like local multiplayer!!!!)
This is a fun and challenging game to play both alone and with a friend (especially with a friend)!
nice chilled tingaling.
A wonderful little game to play with a friend or loved one. Simple but colourful and fun artstyle and music. Two smiles and four tumbs up from me and my wife.
Love this game. Its quite the fun coop game... but it will test your friendship with your best friend! Its easy at first, but it wont take too long before that all changes.

A simplisticly styled game with complex mechanics at work. One of the most fun co-op games you can find, as it will challenge both you and your partner to solve puzzles that are very rewarding to complete. The soundtrack fits the game very well too.

9/10  First off, highly recommended you only buy this game if you are going to play with a buddy.  Anybody who is looking for a co-op puzzle platformer is looking at the right game. The smooth, colorful environment fits the game very well, and the music has a very relaxing tone (most of the time).  The only thing that is stopping me from giving this game a perfect score is that there is one particular puzzle that is great at first, but later gets used again annoyingly. If it wasn't for a particular puzzle, I could say each one is unique.  WARNING FOR ACHIEVEMENT ENTHUSIASTS: You must have an Xbox 360 controller in order to obtain all achievements!
Nearly made me yell at my fianceé, 10/10, would play again.

I got this game for free in humble bundle & i just left this game. After few months (maybe a year), i decided to try this game.  I thought this game would be easy, but in fact we need a bit of intellegence & cooperation. I haven't played multiplayer co-op games for a long time & this game remind me of retro game.  I just play less than an hour, but i'll recommend to anyone who like puzzle mutiplayer co-op games.  95/100 :)
Amazing game for playing co-op! Challenging but very fun. A well polished game with lots of nice little touches.

neat little puzzle-ish game. needs a friend to play with to rant on if anything goes wrong.  7/10
funny game for 2 players, playing it was never boring!

got the best friend edition of this game for super cheap and had a good bit of fun with this title. if you look around you can get 2 copies of this game for less then $5. i did have a strange glitch where i seen enemies that my friend could not see but they could only effect me as well. im sure it would have sorted itself out if i restarted the game but whatever. the art is funny and nice looking at the same time. gameplay is nice but after a while some bits will take a bit of thinking to keep going. so im going to give this game a 8/10 cute and fun little mini game. hardly anything wrong with it at all.
After protal this must be one of the most amazing 2 player co-op games ever made. Kudos to the creators!

- Forgetting that the genre of the game was 'puzzle', not 'keyboard timing skill' (Impossible to play with bad connection) - Beating the last level as a result of a bug.  + Puzzle designs and every fantastic thing that is not mentioned above.

Great coop platformer which provides for a bunch of funny, frustrating, rewarding moments with a friend. Controls are super responsive and puzzles are really nicely thought, making getting into the game a zero effort task.  Although the pointers help communicating and synchronizing the moves with the other, voice chat is super recommended, not for coordination, but for sharing your laughs and victorious remarks, as well as the expletives when either of you repeat some actions for the 111th time and the other fails miserably that one time when you were about done with the current puzzle.  10/10 would troll and be trolled by my buddy again.
Tooooooooo cute~~~~~~~ But my fellow REFUSED to play with me again...I UNDERSTAND. :(
Loved it!

Would recommend this for people who really enjoy co-op puzzle games. It's a cute game and you get a good laugh. I don't rage at this game because it's just so enjoyable. play it with someone you enjoy gaming with!

One of my favorite 2-player couch co-op games of all time. Make sure you have controllers to play. Can be frustrating at times, but very rewarding to finally figure out the puzzles. Great game to play with the SO.
Fun to spend time on

I want to love this game. It's cute, the controlls are tight. The puzzles ARE good. I want to reccomend this game...  but I cant.  There's a big brick wall of problems here and there. While the puzzles are designed well there are more than a few instances of mechanics placed around the puzzle as if to throw you off of the answer (mechanical level was a big one for us). There is also a DISTINCT lack of button use. Sure the game is jump and that's it, but we had to restart a handful of levels simply because there's no die option. If you get stuck, too bad, restart the whole level. There is a series of levels in the dark where your visibility is limited. We quit here, and are unsure if we will return, the design felt cheap at this point, with synthetic difficulty.
